Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.customcomponents.bookshelf

Class BookshelfView

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.customcomponents.bookshelf.BookshelfView
All Implemented Interfaces:
MyShelfieComponent, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
OpponentBookshelfView, PersonalBookshelfView
abstract class BookshelfView extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane implements MyShelfieComponent
The `BookshelfView` class represents a graphical component that displays a bookshelf in a board game. It provides a visual representation of the bookshelf and allows customization of its appearance. The bookshelf is composed of multiple cells that can hold tiles.

Version: 2.0 Since: 15/06/2023

The bookshelf view is an abstract class and should be extended to create specific bookshelf types.

The bookshelf view supports the following features:

  • Customizable bookshelf appearance using CSS
  • Automatic binding of coordinates to bookshelf cells
  • Dynamic updating of cell style based on tile presence
  • Conversion to a matrix representation for data storage
  • Customizable decorations for the bookshelf component

Example usage: 


 BookshelfView bookshelf = new ConcreteBookshelfView();
 // Customize the appearance of the bookshelf using CSS
 bookshelf.getStylesheets().add("path/to/custom.css");
 // Add the bookshelf component to a parent container
 parentContainer.getChildren().add(bookshelf);

The bookshelf view requires a CSS file for customization, which can be set using the `CSS_FILE_PATH` constant.

The bookshelf view provides methods for accessing and manipulating the bookshelf cells and converting the bookshelf into a matrix representation.

Since:
15/06/2023
Version:
2.0
Author:
Tommaso Trabacchin, Melanie Tonarelli, Emanuele Valsecchi, Adem Shehi

    • initBookShelfCell

      @NotNull private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane initBookShelfCell(String... cellId)
      Initialize and retrieves a tile's container for the bookshelf that by default:

      • will have an ID format as follows: cell + row + column;

        where:

        • cell: is a standard string
        • row: is a number representing the row in which the element is placed
        • column: is a number representing the column in which the element is placed
      • a style class that corresponds to the BookshelfViewType chosen
      • a listener that is used to updated the style class of the cell based on it's children (click for more information)
      Parameters:
      cellId - the unique ID to set at the bookshelf's cell
      Returns:
      a tile's container for the bookshelf

    • setupCellListener

      private void setupCellListener(@NotNull javafx.scene.layout.StackPane cell)

      Add a listener at the cell passed as parameter.

      The listener is used to switch between different bookshelf-cell's style according to the different bookshelf-type

      Parameters:
      cell - the bookshelf cell on which applies the listener
